Intervention: Patients with BMI over 25 years of age receiving ampicillin/sulbactam prophylaxis
Patients with BMI over 25 years of age who do not receive a prophylaxis antibiotic
Eligibility: Women at all ages with early breast cancer (stage I-II) and American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) I-II score.
- Ductal cancer in situ (CDIS; stage 0 cancer),
• History of receipt of antibiotics in the previous 3 months,
• History of reaction to the study of antibiotics,
• Refusal to sign the consent form.
Results: Number of patients with body mass index (BMI) of more than 25 who developed surgical site infection (SSI) in groups that received antibiotic prophylaxis (prophylaxis group) and not prophylaxis (non-prophylaxis group).
Title of the arm/group: Prophylaxis Group
Description of the arm/group: patients with BMI over 25 years of age receiving ampicillin/sulbactam prophylaxis
Title of arm/group: No prophylaxis group
Description of the arm/group: Patients with BMI over 25 years of age who do not receive antibiotic prophylaxis
